definition[0]: a system to prevent or reduce dangerous accidents or mistakes
definition[1]: the practice of managing investments in ways that produce as much profit as possible while limiting the danger of losses
definition[2]: the managing of the risks related to a company’s activities in a way that limits possible financial losses, for example by obtaining the best types of insurance for the risks involved
example[0]: Talk to our risk management department about your company’s current management of illnesses and accidents.
definition[3]: the managing of investments in ways that produce as much profit as possible while limiting the danger of losses
